name: Caltweet
overview:
Caltweet Promote on Twitter & Facebook.

Caltweet (AKA Calendar Tweet) What started off as a simple event management app has morphed into an online promotional tool that is well integrated with Twitter & Facebook Connect which allows users to promote on both simultaneously.

The site lost traction for about a day after twitter enhanced their user experience and added the NO duplicate tweets. (Random number to each tweet to get above the duplicate text implemented by Twitter)

Which is one of the core features that I love about Caltweet is their control over auto tweets to promote their events & products even when there not online up to 4 times per day to prevent spamming we limited this, but will allow customization of each custom tweet in the future for “Caltweet Business” amongst other features that give users more control over there promotional efforts.

Other features include:

RSVP confirmation which will prompt to allows us to update their twitter & facebook status with “@MichaelRevell is attending Techcrunch writes about Caltweet http://caltweet.com/r1 <–Click to Attend”

You can invite the people that follow you, but NOT the people you follow. Your followers can also invite their followers. When invited the system sends a DM to the user on Twitter that says “@username is inviting you to Techcrunch writes about Caltweet http://caltweet.com/r1<–click to attend

The system organizes a twitter guestlist and also google maps integrated and google calendar syncs for events. When logged in the system.

All these and more are features on the user side.

On the event search side. You can find events by tags, auto-generated Ajax search, and also separate events by city/state on the All Events page.

I’ve seen people promoting events, to products, website launches, online coupons and more.
